db:abstract.db:para: The QDBusPendingCallWatcher class provides a convenient way for waiting for asynchronous replies.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.5.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QDBusPendingCallWatcher::QDBusPendingCallWatcher(const QDBusPendingCall &call, QObject *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QDBusPendingCallWatcher object to watch for replies on the asynchronous pending call call and sets this object's parent to parent.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] QDBusPendingCallWatcher::~QDBusPendingCallWatcher()
db:section.db:para: Destroys this object. If this QDBusPendingCallWatcher object was the last reference to the unfinished pending call, the call will be canceled.

db:section.db:title: void QDBusPendingCallWatcher::finished(QDBusPendingCallWatcher *self = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the pending call has finished and its reply is available. The self parameter is a pointer to the object itself, passed for convenience so that the slot can access the properties and determine the contents of the reply.

db:section.db:title: bool QDBusPendingCallWatcher::isFinished() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the pending call has finished processing and the reply has been received.
Note that this function only changes state if you call waitForFinished() or if an external D-Bus event happens, which in general only happens if you return to the event loop execution.

db:section.db:title: void QDBusPendingCallWatcher::waitForFinished()
db:section.db:para: Suspends the execution of the calling thread until the reply is received and processed. After this function returns, isFinished() should return true, indicating the reply's contents are ready to be processed.
